question_text: A 34-year-old woman is evaluated for the acute onset of a spreading skin lesion on the right forehead, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is impetigo (Option C), which is a superficial skin infection characterized by a yellowish, crusted surface. It may be caused by staphylococci or streptococci. If Staphylococcus aureus is the cause, secretion of exfoliative toxin may result in superficial blister formation (bullous impetigo). Diagnosis of impetigo is typically made based on clinical appearance.
